block.p: Grace Glueck and Milt Freudenheim were married on Friday evening at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Wilbur A. Levin in Manhattan. Mr. Levin, the county clerk of Kings County, N.Y., officiated.

Ms. Glueck is a former culture editor, art critic and reporter for The New York Times, who regularly contributes art criticism to the newspaper. She wrote ''New York: The Painted City'' (Gibbs Smith, 1992) and is a co-author of ''Brooklyn: People and Places, Past and Present'' (Harry N. Abrams, 1991). Ms. Glueck, who is keeping her name, graduated from New York University, and is the daughter of the late Mignon and Ernest Glueck, who lived in Rockville Centre, N.Y.
Grace Glueck and Milt Freudenheim were married on Friday evening at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Wilbur A. Levin in Manhattan. Mr. Levin, the county clerk of Kings County, N.Y., officiated.

Ms. Glueck is a former culture editor, art critic and reporter for The New York Times, who regularly contributes art criticism to the newspaper. She wrote ''New York: The Painted City'' (Gibbs Smith, 1992) and is a co-author of ''Brooklyn: People and Places, Past and Present'' (Harry N. Abrams, 1991). Ms. Glueck, who is keeping her name, graduated from New York University, and is the daughter of the late Mignon and Ernest Glueck, who lived in Rockville Centre, N.Y.

Mr. Freudenheim is a business and financial reporter at The Times. He graduated from the University of Michigan, and is the son of Patricia Freudenheim of Longboat Key, Fla., and the late Milton B. Freudenheim. The bridegroom was a widower.
